title: Very responsive and professional
body: Being new to Bristol, was a little nervous joining such a large medical centre, but they're great and it's a very well run practice. They're incredibly busy, but who isn't?  We usually get appointments quickly or at least in a reasonable time.  Most importantly, the care my family have received is very professional, attentive and skilled.

title: Very helpful and friendly staff
body: I called on 24th August regarding I want Dr Pratheep to write letter for some reason and Dr Pratheep done it on same day which I realy appreciate and the reception staff are great Diane, Kelly and all staff are very helpful.

title: Fantastic practice
body: The practice is fantastic- every doctor and nurse we have interacted with have been thorough and professional and supportive- we have never had any trouble getting hold of the practice or being seen if needed and the staff are so friendly and caring- as a family we feel so lucky to have such a great gp surgery who are always there when we need- they truly go above and beyond

title: Fantastic help and attention
body: I had to bring my sister to this department on Thursday 18/8/22  we received so much help and care both from the triage receptionist and the nursing practitioner- after a very thorough check a call was made for my sister to go to A & E in Derby. She is still in hospital and sadly is very , very ill. Many thanks for your superb service .

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: One of the Most caring GP Doctors
body:
Dr Aggarwal is amazing! He walks the extra mile to provide his patients with treatment and care. Very few Doctors can match upto his extensive clinical knowledge and acumen. He matches this with a personal care, calls patients to ensure their welfare and follows up their onward referrals to the hospital meticulously. He is very well respected by the Consultants in the hospital and they value his input and referrals.
Despite all his achievements he constantly updates his encyclopaedic knowledge constantly making sure his patients receive Top Notch care.
He truly is an inspiration for all the younger generation of aspiring Doctors

title: The best GP surgery I’ve ever come across
body:
You never hear anybody talking highly of GP’s but this practice is absolutely amazing. They always have appointments available, yes you may have to call during the requested times but that isn’t a problem I don’t see why people make a fuss of it. The system they have for booking appointments works extremely well, I’ve used engage consult a few times with no intent to speak directly to a doctor and they always book in an appointment within the next 2 hours. Absolutely amazing, the staff are lovely and I think all the GP have incredible knowledge. Test results I’ve always had back within the same day, reception always answer emails asap and I just think the surgery works amazingly and efficiently. If it wasn’t for the staff here I wouldn’t be where I am now the doctors have always listened to me and not let down my symptoms, they’ve actioned everything. And I’ve been to this practice a lot and the doctors are always on time for the appointments and don’t have you waiting long, I’ve never had issues with getting through on the phone either.

Well done to the management and staff at this practice for maintaining an amazing yet efficient manner.

title: Good consultation
body: For my first consultation with the practice I am impressed. The Doctor took time to listen and advise accordingly. I didn’t feel rushed and they went through things in detail with me. Overall very pleased so far.

title: Amazing care
body:
I will never be able to praise all of the staff on the childrens ward highly enough for everything they did for us. 

Their compassion, attention to detail and competence has gone a long way to saving our sons life.

We will always be grateful for everything you have done for us, Arlo-Johns Parents.

title: the best staff..very kind
body: very kind,allways there..very gratefull..kendry can deal with anything..the treatments and staff are second to none..thank you

title: Always great service
body: The Klinik system works very well - normally within filling in the form I get a call back within 15 mins to discuss an appt or a text scheduling a call with the doctor. All reception staff and medical staff have always gone above and beyond - not a bad word to say. I feel very lucky to have this surgery as my doctors. Thanks everyone who works there.

title: Reception & nurses great, can’t get near a doctor
body: The reception staff are so helpful and the nurses and phlebotomy staff are great too. Getting to even speak to a GP is difficult. Even when I booked an appointment with a GP it got passed on to someone else. Can’t do online for kids either.

title: Absolutely wonderful service
body: Attended sced department which was in the fracture  clinic what a wonderful set of staff. They were caring and made me feel like a human being and not a nuisance. The care and understanding I received was second to none. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Working their socks off and really helped me
body: The nurse that assessed me at the door was brilliant he went out of his way to listen and knew what I needed. This a and e is very busy and patients can sometimes be irritable and unkind but that does not stop the staff from doing their very best to help people in all kinds of situations. I was there for 8 hours - assessment completed with bp and egc, 2 injunctions and a session with a doctor. Every single staff member I spoke to were helpful and caring even though they are under tremendous pressure. They helped me and I am grateful. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent and caring
body: My 2 year old was unwell this morning and needed nebuliser treatment - everyone was so caring. The people complaining are those who either shout loudest and shouldn’t be in a and e or who need to canvas their MP about the NHS - everyone there was lovely and working tireless to help - thanks so much!

title: A disgrace for the NHS
body: This place is an absolute disgrace ! From reception to some of the health professionals. I have been there for 2y. I had so many outrageous situations were they have been unprofessional, didn’t follow up, made mistakes in their notes, forgetting appointment, rudeness and so much more. Having young children registered there is incredibly stressful . It takes days to have an appointment even for a sick baby. Don’t register here.

title: Disgusting
body: Don't bother going to A&E at Stepping Hill if you're actually ill. Stub your toe and they're all over you but treat actually ill patients like dirt. Didn't listen to what I had to say, gave me roughly 1/3 of an examination then told me to chase up Gastro referral with my GP - I'm already under the Surgeons for this problem. They should have got a Dr down to see me but they couldn't be bothered. The only person who cared was the receptionist in xray. Give Stepping Hill A&E 0/10

title: Mental health-not helpful comunication.
body: I tried booking an appointment through askmygp as advice. I spoke to a lady who said I could only request an appointment for for that day or they could offer me 3 different dates at the same time (9am) as that's all they were aloud to offer me. I'm a single parent with two children with extreem mental heath issues. I tried to explain that I can't do 9am as its school time and I carnt do same day appointments as I have to emotionally prepare myself to be able to leave the house and struggle speaking to people on the phone (which is one of the reasons I was happy when i realised I could request appointments online) and that actually I was really struggling speaking to the lady I was on the phone to at that time. She then told me she was putting me through to her manager because I'd apparently said I didn't want to talk to her and she wasn't being helpful. I tried explaining that that is not what I was saying, that I was saying I struggle emotionally speaking to anyone on the one so speaking to someone on the phone and then having maybe minute to prepare and leave my house to get to an appointment was not something I could emotionally cope with. She transferred me anyway. Her manager then went over everything again (by this point I was shaking and extremely panicy). She then questioned weather I had anyone to look after my children/take them to school and suggested childminders, family or friend. I said I had no one childcare wise. She then tried offering me weekends when I'd already said i had no child care and had requested during school times because it couldn't be discussed around my children (issues with my vagin caused by childhood sexual abuse). She did then offer me an appointment at a time and day I could get to however said that she could over ride the system this once but as I am a one of case it wasn't something they were generally aloud to do. That they have to go with the normal census. I then said that no single parent would be able to get to the times they are aloud to give out (9am) and that actually alot of people struggle communicating on the phone and have anxiety issues, that I didn't appreciate that nothing was put in place for people like myself and that I personally think the first lady I'd spoken to was rather rude for someone who should have shown an understanding for mental health needs (in the same was as they show consideration for people with other kids of disabilities). She continued to state that they have to go with the norm and that her colleague had tried everything she could and that id got my appointment hadnt i. I asked how to complain and put the phone down. I then had an anxiety attack that lasted 20 minutes (while trying to look after two children). I have then spent the rest of the day so far numb and dissociation. I don't appreciate being made to feel liken an anomaly and an inconvenience. It makes me want to apologise for having mental health and that's not how contacting your doctors should make you feel.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The care I received has been brilliant
body: I have been on this ward since Monday and the care I received has been brilliant, the nursing staff are taking great care of me I couldn’t be happier. I don’t feel as if there needs to be any improvements to the ward, it’s a good size and all the patients have their own space, there’s a few different toilets and showers and there all very clean.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff were all very welcoming
body: I was transferred over from Daisy Hill hospital to Craigavon, both hospitals have been great. An ambulance brought me over and the staff on board were all very friendly, which was lovely. When I arrived onto the ward the staff were all very welcoming, they made me feel comfortable and made sure I was okay. The food in this hospital has been very nice, the menu has so much different choices that are suitable for all different diets.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Misguided and mislead by staff at clininc
body:
My wife is at risk of cancer and the clinic staff dont even know how to do there job.

I call on monday morning 8 am to ask clinic for my wife hospital reference. They give wrong information and never admit.i call again that evening they give some information about booking reference i call hospital next morning they said they dont have that booking reference.. i call clinic back the lady said its not that hospital its other hospital. I call that hospital and they said we dont have that booking reference i call the clinic back and they said its the same hospital before.. and they lost track of booking reference and there refrence team will contact me in a week to sort this out.. and this all thing is of 2 months..

title: Fantastic patient support and care
body: Attended an outpatients clinic with my spritely 96 year old mother yesterday. The skin cancer care team were fantastic. The care and understanding shown by the lead consultant and the nurse during the explanation of the diagnostic screening results and possible future treatment was exemplary. Thank you.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have been made to feel at home and comfortable on this ward
body: I have been made to feel at home and comfortable on this ward by all the staff, they work very hard and try their best at all times. The communication with them is good they are very professional, as they always make sure to update me with any new information, but at the same time always stop for a chat. The food has been okay, my appetite is poor and I’m very fussy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff work to the best of their abilities
body: The care in the hospital has been very good so far and that is thank to the staff. Every single one of them that I have come into contact with have been well and truly excellent and there isn’t a bad word I could say about them. They all do their respective jobs to the best of their abilities and they have all helped me understand everything thanks to their clear and concise explanations. The food has been okay there are some things that I don’t like which limits the options slightly. I have had no issues at all and am very happy with my care so far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nurses go above and beyond
body: I can’t complain about the care in the hospital it has honestly been brilliant so far and I don’t have a bad word that I could say about it, so far at least. I have had no issues since I was admitted which has been a blessing. The nurses have been so good and always go above and beyond for me and spend so much time making sure I am alright and have no issues. The doctors are excellent with their explanation and I have been able to understand my condition and everything else. I am very happy with my care and the fact I have had no issues at all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: DanielleR94
title: Very long wait for scans
body:
I went to A&E on Friday at 1:00 pm I was triaged within 10 minutes and put into the waiting room. I had a cannula put in and bloods taken within a further 10 minutes and given oramorph due to the worst right sided abdominal pain which radiated into my back. Then it took from 1:00pm until 8:00pm for me to have a CT scan.  
I got the results of this scan at 8:30 was put on a drip and was told I would be admitted to the gynae ward. It was 12:00pm before I got to the gynae ward and then another 4 hours until I got my bed on the ward. I saw a doctor on the gynae ward and was told I needed to be nil by mouth (I had only had a sandwich in the last 24hours by this point anyway). I was seen by another gynae doctor at 7:00 am and told I needed an ultrasound because I could have ovarian torsion. It wasn’t until 2:00pm that I was told the scan wouldn’t be until 10:00am the following morning.  
I was told I could eat and was given a sandwich as I had missed the lunch due to being nil by mouth. The next morning at 10:00am I had my ultrasound and was told I had a normal cyst on my ovary and could be discharged. I waited until 2:00pm and still hadn’t been discharged and had only eaten 2 sandwiches in 48hours. I was ultimately kept in hospital for 2 nights and 3 nearly full days to be told there wasn’t a cause for my abdominal pain. Why couldn’t that ultrasound have been done in A&E? no wonder the NHS is on its knees when I could have been sent home 48hours earlier.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff couldn't do enough
body: The care that I have got in Trauma Ward has been absolutely excellent so far and there isn’t a bad word that I could say about it. It truly has been superb, They are all very good at what they do and are very caring and kind. They put up with a lot, their job is very difficult yet they never complain, they just get on with it and keep working very hard. I am able to understand all of them and the only time that there is any issues is due to their accents. However, I still get most of it and I understand it must be just as difficult for them. The staff couldn’t do enough for me and thankfully I have had no issues at all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff have all been excellent
body: My care has been pretty decent so far and there have been no real issues to report so far. The staff have all been excellent so far and are all brilliant at what they do. The cleaners are excellent at cleaning, the doctors are excellent at communicating, and the nurses are brilliant at everything. I have been able to understand them all very easily. The food has not been the best, I don’t really enjoy it, however it does fill me up. The care in the hospital has been very good and I have had no issues at all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Caring staff
body: On Monday I underwent gynae surgery at qmc, I work in the  nhs myself and am acutely aware of the pressures that staff are working under. I wanted to feedback how impressed I was with all the staff I came into contact with. From gynae pre admissions, to patient escorts, to theatre, recovery and ward a23 I was treated in a kind, caring and professional way by all the staff I came into contact with. This made a big difference to my patient experience and I am grateful. I hope this will be fed back to these staff.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care in the hospital has been very good
body: My care in the hospital has been very good so far. I really can’t fault anything that I have seen. The nurses are all very pleasant, they have all been so nice and have all been very helpful, which is very nice as I know they are always there to help me out. The doctors are the same and I understand most of what they say, and if I don’t they are more than happy to answer many questions. The food's below average sometimes, it's okay but a lot of the time I don’t like it. I am happy enough with everything and have had no issues.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Isn't a bad word I could say
body: The care in the hospital has been pretty excellent so far. I really can’t complain about the care that I have received in the hospital. The nurses that the hospital has have been brilliant so far bad, there isn’t a bad word I could say about them. They are incredibly kind and work so hard for us patients. The doctors are excellent so far and have helped me with understanding everything which I very much appreciate. I have had no issues and am very happy with my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Disappointed, again
body:
Following previous reviews on this site, I would also like to say the doctors and nurses are really great and professional. The reception team are extremely unhelpful to the point of uncooperative.

I have been helping my daughter sort out an appointment for a urine infection.  She called, as requested, first thing this morning and managed to get an appointment with a doctor who was extremely helpful and asked her to take in a urine sample immediately, which she did.   The doctor said she would call her at 1pm with the results of a dip test. 1pm came and went, so my daughter called this afternoon and was told by reception that she would have to wait 48 hours for test results, bearing in mind we have the long weekend ahead of us.  When I got in from work we decided to go to the surgery and find out if my daughter could find out what the results were and hopefully get some antibiotics as she was in a lot of pain and discomfort, but we were told we would have to wait for the results, or call again tomorrow morning at 8am or 12.30pm for another appointment.  We explained that my daughter works in a shop and had to work tomorrow - a long shift covering the hours of the opening hours of the surgery.  The answer was 'If you were that unwell you wouldn't be going to work'  A totally unacceptable way to speak to a young person.  Not everyone has all the time in the world to make appointments in person or hang on the phone for what seems like hours. 

Eventually, after a lot of discussion between us and the receptionist, we were told that a note would be left for the doctor. She actually called within half an hour and apologised. Apparently the urine sample had not been given to her and therefore had not even been tested.  All of this conversation was being heard by other patients in the waiting room.  No confidentiality at all. 

I haven't even got to the blood test results my daughter is waiting for ... initially another 2 week wait for results and after almost begging, now just over a week.  Absolutely disgraceful.

The lovely doctor's practice I have been a patient of for 55 years is a shambles.

Please, please do something about this awful situation to help your loyal patients.

title: Above and beyond
body:
Since having my two daughters (first in 2018 and second earlier this year in Feb 22) I have always been so thoroughly impressed (and grateful!) for the level of care, professionalism and dedication shown by all staff at this practice. 
The reception staff are incredibly helpful and accommodating, and even the dreaded 8am phone calls for an appointment are never too stressful, the queues are tackled quickly and appointments made available.  The nurses and doctors go above and beyond to support us. Whatever our visits are for, we are made to feel listened to and well cared for. I am grateful that my family are cared for under this practice. A huge thanks to all at Warwick Gates Family Health Centre for all your hard work

author: Zozo10
title: I feel very lucky to have had such exemplary care from the NHS!
body:
Just wanted to give feedback on the care I received last week.  
After a freak accident, which resulted in me breaking 3 bones in my ankle, I was admitted into Ward 10D & got surgery 2 days later. From the very first person who I encountered at A&E to the numerous nurses, health care support workers and throughout my stay- I can honestly say I was treated so well & with such kindness, nothing was too much trouble.  
As a fellow health care professional who has also worked for the NHS, I felt truly humbled by my hospital stay, it honestly made a very traumatic experience so seamless from admission to hospital to surgery & discharge. I feel very lucky to have had such exemplary care from the NHS!

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

title: appalling surgery
body:
blood test on 16th august have to wait over 3 weeks for a appointment to speak to a doctor to discuss results
appalling surgery

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Happy with my care
body: The care in the ward has been absolutely great so far, which I know I am very pleased with. The nurses that look after me are all very nice and nothing that I ask is too much for them. They are really kind and have been lovely so far, really can’t fault any of them. The doctors are also pretty great, I understand them pretty well. The food's been okay, I have enjoyed it alright. I have had no issues and can’t really complain as my care has been good and I am happy with it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Absolutely baffled
body: I phoned Fittleworth to place an order for a prescription, I only needed barrier rings, adhesive remover and absorber gel sachets, because I wasn't ordering any pouches the above are deemed accessories, so therefore they couldn't send them,I have enough pouches to last another month but can't use them without the barrier rings, I'm told this is a decision from the NHS which I will be following up,having a stoma is stressful in itself without this added stress, I'm really confused and angry.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Can't really complain about anything
body: My care in the ward has been pretty excellent so far and that is thanks to all the staff. The nurses are so kind and have done so much for me since I was admitted. All the staff in fact have been excellent and all are so willing to help. If they play a part in my care they are amazing with their explanations, or if they don’t know something they find out and update me which is great and keeps me updated. The food's been good enough and I can’t really complain about anything.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

The doctors are the same and absolute great at what they do and I have been able to understand them all very easily. I have had no issues with anything, from the type of food to the cleaning, it’s all been great so far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: First class service
body:
Story by carer of 70-79 year old patient from Derry/Londonderry area.  
The initial response was very good. The continuing visits over the weekend were reassuring and excellent. First class service and professional. The nurses were very understanding and calming to the patients needs.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care's pretty good
body: My care in the hospital has been pretty good so far and I can’t really say anything bad as I have had no issues at all so far. The nurses in the hospital have been very kind so far. They are always there to help and no matter what they ask they will help me out and make sure that I have no issues. The doctors are all lovely and I have been able to understand all of them so far. The food has been pretty decent so far and thanks to the staff I have had no issues so far and no complaints either.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53

title: Doctors talk so clearly
body: My care on the orthopaedics ward has been very good so far and I have been left with no complaints since I was admitted into the hospital. The nurses have been so kind so far and really have no bad words to say about them. They have all been so kind and are always working so hard being as helpful as they physically can be which I know I appreciate. The doctors are the same and have been very easy to understand due to how clearly they talk. The food's been alright and I have had no real issues it anything so far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Kaz81
title: Came to change my contraception inplant
body: Nurses were looking after me-I had my pregnancy tests, blood pressure checked, my weight and height. Both Nikki and Juliet looked after me,calmed me down and were very kind.

author: indiapn76
title: Miscommunication and nonsensical prescribing
body:
I have been working with inclusion for a good few weeks now. In that time I have been subject to multiple miscommunications regarding an important prescription.  
I was told that after my second meeting with my case worker I would be on weekly prescriptions due to my physical health needs. This was then rebutted by the prescriber upon screening, saying that I may be on a daily collection for upwards of 3 months. This was not outlined and I was expecting mutual respect and adequate communication. This need was not met.  
To further this, the Gosport service managed to forget to hand me my prescription on the day of a reduction, causing me a massive amount of hassle and anxiety.  
The goalposts keep moving but my work stays the same. I have been unable to engage in project work due to the lack of communication from the team so far. I hope this is noted and can be resolved for others, as I can see why this would put anyone off this service.

author: pepperps36
title: Professional , caring and understanding
body:
I self signed with Ealing IAPT I thought I would not hear back or get an appointment booked.  
Suffering from very low depression and anxiety and just feeling very low about myself ,I was so glad when that call came in and I managed to book in with a Therapist, Eunice-she is very professional ,caring and understanding. At times when suffering I wished I had a friend like her or just someone to talk to when you are feeling down , she breaks things down and makes you realise certain situations.  
I was sent a booklet about anxiety so I am able to look at this whenever I need it. I was taught about boundaries and thinking about myself as I have family.  
The sessions helped a lot and I felt very comfortable and happy when I was able to express my feelings.  
When I do feel down I always think about what Eunice would say, pause and think about the situation at hand.  
Ealing IAPT helped me so much that when it came to rescheduling my appointment due to my daughter being in hospital for a medical condition she has.They were able to help and continue my sessions- I can not thank them enough for the help and service I was given.  
If I need help in the future I will most definitely refer myself again.

author: listenrc33
title: Knee Replacement
body:
I had a knee replacement in August. I had seen my GP and consultants about this over quite a few years. I tried to put it off until the pain became unbearable. I was quite pleased with the timescale as I was advised initially I would be seen in June 2022 but due to Covid there would be a delay. I think I was given a cancellation date as I wasn’t expecting the op until later in the year.  
I had my op at The Victoria Hospital in Kirkcaldy.  
I am still recovering, but although I continue to have some pain, I am pleasantly surprised how well everything has gone. I need to go back to see the surgeon in September but I expect to be given the all clear by then.  
I am able to walk without crutches but do use them outside.  
I would like to say how great everyone was from the surgeon, anaesthetist, nurses etc. The service I got was exemplary. Thank you so much. I am hoping that it will transform my life.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Have been recovering very nicely
body: My care in the hospital has gone pretty well so far, seem to be recovering nicely and to be honest. I haven’t really had any problems with anything except the food, which has been a bit meh. It's never cold and fills me, just a bit tasteless at times. The staff in the hospital have all been so kind so far and are always there to help me out and always so good. Everything that I have seen has been very good and I am happy with it all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: antliaxr97
title: Kept informed at every stage of the process
body:
I was in the Day Surgery Unit in Queen Margaret hospital in August 2022.  
I cannot praise all the staff enough for their kindness, care and professionalism. The nurses on the unit, the nurses in theatre, the anaesthetist and my consultant all treated me so well and I would like to thank them very much indeed. I was kept informed at every stage of the process and I have even had a phone call this morning to make sure I am okay following the surgery.  
I can't thank everyone enough

author: disinfectantwq77
title: Staff nice
body: Amazing staff who made me feel so comfortable and safe and explained everything in a way I could understand too which really helped.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been so kind and have the best hearts
body: I arrived in Lurgan and the staff have been so kind and have the best hearts, Every single staff member including nurses, doctors, cleaners, physio staff and so forth have been so lovely and you are always treated with the upmost respect. The food is so nice and I have very much enjoyed it. The cleanliness is just amazing, the staff work so hard to keep everything hygienic. My physio sessions are going really well and I always look forward to them, the first few I didn’t want to get out of bed but now that I am seeing a difference it is keeping me hugely motivated.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff go above and beyond
body: I was brought over to Lurgan Hospital by my daughter last week. The food isn’t my favourite so I’m always grateful when a visitor of mine brings me up some nice treats to have with a cup of tea. The staff really do go above and beyond for you, the care has been amazing. I have been telling my family how well looked after I am and that it's like staying in a hotel, although I don’t know if I would be booking another visit!😂😂😂

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: RDS08
title: Massive thank you to all of the staff on the day ward
body:
I would like to say a massive thank you to the nurses and surgical staff. When I had a small operation, I was very nervous and the two nurses that greeted me really made me feel at ease. My operation was in July. They kept checking on me and keeping me updated. The surgical team were also so kind.  
I am so very grateful to them, you're a great team and I am so thankful for the care given to me.  
You're amazing.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good communication
body: The staff are all so pleasant and caring. The food is rather nice, I am not that fussy so I tend to try something a little different at each meal time. My ambulance was booked for me to be brought over to Lurgan, so everything went smoothly and there was no waiting around. The cleaners do a great job always keeping the place lovely and clean. Communication from staff is very good, they all communicate with each other as well greatly as I am rarely ever being asked the same things multiple times from different staff members which was not the case in the previous hospital I was in.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: SOCmp36
title: The team did a fantastic job
body: A successful cardioversion after the third attempt. The team did a fantastic job and in particular cardiac nurse Christy was excellent in manner, politeness, courtesy and respect.

author: saturnkd65
title: mental health support in north ayrshire, scotland.
body: I have a borderline personality disorder. (classed as chronic now because of my age). I have made two suicide attempts in the last year in hope of taking my life. 1 in september 2021 and the other in june 2022. Both were reported to nhs doctors after the fact. The first was reported by my respiratory doctor with yet another rejection by the mental health team. The second was discussed with my diabetes doctor on an unexpected call. She passed the information to my gp as she said that this kind of information passed on by other medical professionals was generally ignored unless submitted by a gp. You wonder why people take their own lives? To be honest,all the cpn have done is to put up suggestions which are totally unreasonable and pass the buck on to charitable organisations who do not do what the supposed mental health team claim. My saga has been going on for 20 years plus. I fear the worst

author: homamtz33
title: The whole team have been amazing
body:
In June this year I went into hospital with a urine infection and my blood results showed that I had the Covid virus.  
It caused me to become delirious and resulted in a loss of memory. The medical centre in Kilbirnie forbade me to drive and put me in the care of the district nurse called Maggie.  
I have to tell you that she has completely changed my life, and with the help of a team of carers I am once again able to drive and will no longer need carers to visit me four times a day.  
Maggie is outstanding and is such a lovely woman. From the start she took me shopping and we bought £50 worth of healthier, low-fat, low-sugar options as an alternative to all the sweet stuff that I was buying. I have diabetes and my blood sugars were sky high. I was having to take pills and a twice daily injection of insulin to control it.  
The whole team of carers - Maggie, Carol, Lauren, Shannon and Joan - have been amazing and I send them all my undying gratitude and thanks.  
I hope that you get to read this, Maggie, and that you are aware of how much you have helped me. These mere words do not begin to tell the whole story.  
So I give my thanks to Maggie and the team of carers that I have mentioned. I now count you as my friends.  
May God bless you and keep you all safe and well.

readBy.name: North Ayrshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Hath921
title: Supportive health visitor
body:
Health visitor Nikki has been so supportive to me as a new mum.  
As a first time mum I felt I didn’t know what to expect, what was expected of me, and what to do. Nikki helped reassure me with explaining milestones and how we would work together step by step on my babies journey. We have been dealing with allergies and Nikki has been so informative and has helped guide me through diet change, diary taking, made me aware of symptoms to look out for, medication administration. All while being sure I knew she was there if I ever needed to ask any questions and in those early days of dealing with an unwell baby - asked me how I was also coping.  
Throughout this whole journey she has made me feel as though I am in control, and never once made me feel as if I would be judged for any decision I made. In the early days other professionals made me feel forced to breastfeed and I felt I would be judged for stopping even when I was struggling which made me struggle, whereas Nikki always made me feel she would support me regardless of which decision I made. She also helped reassure me again, made sure I knew there were local support groups and helped me with any questions I had. This support helped me continue my breastfeeding journey. I feel so lucky to have a health visitor who is so approachable.

author: corridorrg54
title: Excellent A&E visit
body:
Had to take my 95 year old mum to the Emergency Department at North Devon hospital.  
I tried to get to minor injury unit but the closest was nearly 30 miles away, so our local A@E it was. Mum had a swollen and painful ring finger her wedding and engagement ring, which has worn for nearly 70 years, needed to be removed. We had tried several things to reduce the swelling and get the rings off but it was too painful.  
We knew from the hospital website that wait times were 3-4 hours but the rings had to come off.  
All the team at the hospital were excellent, friendly and helpful.  
We had not waited long when a newly qualified T.A called us and quickly and efficiently removed he rings, making sure my mum realised the rings where to be cut and then gave us a pot to keep them safe.  
Thank you everyone for this excellent service at such a challenging time for you all.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Libby 66
title: The nurses made my visit as stress free as possible
body:
After a nasty accident to my leg, I attended the Minor Injuries Unit at the Queen Elizabeth. We had been there half an hour when my husband asked Janice, the nurse, to have a quick look at my leg because it was an open wound. Without any hesitation, she came and looked at it and decided it needed a dressing on it, just in case there might be any infection in the atmosphere in the waiting room.  
Regardless of how busy she was, she did it immediately. After a wait of about one and a half hours, I was seen in the treatment room. The care I received was second to none. Both nurses explained everything about my wound and what they were doing after my leg was stitched and dressed. I was advised about my after-care.  
I would like to say a big big thank you to both nurses for the care and attention they gave me. They made my visit as stress free as possible in the circumstances.

author: Chlo12444
title: The lovely women made me feel very comfortable
body: The lovely women made me feel very comfortable as I have serve anxiety and depression- lovely lady! X

author: Sandeman
title: The whole experience was so positive
body:
My Mum is in her eighties and was referred to the TIA Hot Clinic at the Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy.  
The consultant, Dr Cvoro was friendly, informative, caring and approachable. She kept my Mum informed all along the diagnosis even though Mum found it difficult as she is hard of hearing and was a little confused due to her having suffered a stroke. Mum was so reassured by her manner and appreciated all that was being done for her.  
The nurses on duty, Debbie and Louise were caring, considerate, gentle, and patient. I can not commend them highly enough for their compassion and care.  
Louise was with us for most of the appointment and her friendly, helpful manner went beyond simple reassurance during such a difficult series of tests for someone in their eighties. (ECG, CAT scan, bloods, etc.) She was a star and clearly enjoys her job and the learning experience it offers!  
The whole experience of Ward 8 RADA TIA Hot Clinic was so positive it is difficult to see what they could improve on, they are clearly getting things right on this ward.  
The toilets were spotless and easy to manoeuvre in.  
If I had to find a negative the ward treatment room was a little too hot and airless but I can accept that on a day in a mid-August summer.  
[Very happy with 'Cleanliness']  
  
[Very happy with 'Toilet']  
  
[Very happy with 'Team work']  
  
[Very happy with 'Treatment']  
  
[Very happy with 'Explanations']  
  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: mercurydw74
title: Not feeling listened to
body:
I didn't feel listened to by the doctor and someone else there and was discharged last year after only being there for 2 months. CAMHS I found worse - I was with them on and off for eight years.  
I was rereferred last October but was declined. I was in Skye house on 5 different occasions for short period of times, then another place and Gartnaval Royal last year. I've been out for 18 months now which is longer than last time I went 16.5 months. I'm really struggling and suffer from ADHD, suspected bipolar and substance abuse disorder. I'm at college and want to have a future in forensic psychology.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: echoqx46
title: Mirena Coil fitting
body:
Throughout the whole time I was made extremely comfortable- the procedure isn’t exactly the most comfortable but I was made to feel at ease.  
Dr Rocke went through absolutely everything with me and during the procedure explained every step and made me feel as comfortable as possible.  
The nurse, Juliet, also made me feel extremely comfortable- she was extremely attentive and kindly held my hand during the procedure and repeatedly comforted me and made sure I was okay (and even made me laugh)!  
Although the actual procedure wasn’t exactly pleasant my time overall was, thanks to these two lovely ladies! :)

author: Celt71
title: Long wait in A&E
body:
A 10 hour wait in A&E with my husbands face and hand bleeding to be told it was now too late to stitch the wounds. They were dressed (very well ) but the cut on his eye was left uncleaned and congealed with blood. Having been unfortunate enough to have to attend A&E often over the years I can honestly say this was the worst experience.  
To add insult, 2 police officers brought in a woman who had had a bump to the head. They didn't manage to sit down before they were called through for treatment and we all saw them leave again 30 mins later. The staff are under immense pressure that obviously cannot be sustained

author: Foot-patient
title: I was always at the centre of what was happening
body:
I wanted to send my thanks to Mr Gibson and his team who were meticulous, empathetic and skilled in the surgery and care during my recent foot operation in Ward 25.  
The whole team went above and beyond to make me feel at ease and supported. From Michaela (I think), the smiling nurse who greeted me when I arrived and reassured me ahead of my foot surgery, to Dr Erin, who consented me and showed empathy and humour which was much appreciated.  
The general good nature of the whole team who worked seamlessly. The theatre team who spoke positively and reassuringly about the operation. Michaela, again, was just there quietly at my side, answering many questions. She took my glasses immediately before the operation and returned them in recovery. Mr Gibson, who spent time with me before and after the operation being kind, reassuring and humorous. The pharmacist and physio who saw me post-op and helped me get back home quickly.  
That evening I had a bleed and phoned Ward 25, where staff nurse Sinead spent time reassuring me in a hilarious chat before suggesting a plan. There was a further six calls between us which only finished when she knew I was being treated by kind, empathetic A&E staff - in particular Dr Lim who came from Ward 25, who after attending to me lined my boot with plastic so the new bandages would not get stained. A charming, easy manner and his skill again gave me reassurance.  
I am also grateful for the pre and post-op care I have received with Amanda and her team in Outpatients 3, who spent time giving care to both my foot and me as a whole.  
In short I am so impressed and grateful for the skill of my surgeon Mr Gibson and his team, but it’s much more. I was always at the centre of what was happening and their humour and kindness allowed me to experience excellent care.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Win Red
title: The staff are an asset to the department
body:
I was recently admitted to Ward 21 CCU Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy after suffering a Heart Attack. I would like to praise all the staff both day and night shift for the care, support and attention they gave me during my stay. The staff are an asset to the department and I can’t thank them enough.  
Dr Francis is a phenomenal man who takes so much time with you as a patient to explain things and support you at a difficult time again I can’t praise him enough.

author: xrayzd67
title: The whole team are trying so hard to get me well
body:
I have a couple of visits a week to my home from a team of community nurses. They're all very good but just lately my wound and pain has been a lot worse and I've had real issues with keeping dressings on, repeated infection and pain levels through the roof  
All the team are really kind and always try their best but sometimes when things feel really bleak a single visit can change everything.  
I haven't slept for more than 30 minutes at a time in days and my leg wounds are weeping. Dressings don't stay on and uncovered the wounds act like a badger is chewing my leg and dipping it in vinegar  
Normally I try and be brave but this morning when the nurse said are you ok I just said no and she quickly figured out I was really struggling. Figuring out what to do, she went off to her car to fetch supplies, down stairs to get some stuff from the bag left here and came upstairs and set about making a sort of sock style padded bandage to help with the soreness the infection and the gunk that was pouring out.  
I don't really even know what she talked to me about but for the first time in several days I smiled and really felt like it mattered that I was ok before she left. She even left behind a spare pad so I could change the dressing before they come next time.  
The whole team are trying so hard to get me well but honestly today that extra mile made such a difference and is the first time in a good few days my pain was under control for long enough for me to nap without waking up crying. Can't over estimate how much that mattered to me and I know that although someone different will come next time they'll know how to make this sock type made up dressing and maybe ,just maybe, that will be a better day too

author: Maybr83
title: I honestly couldn’t fault anything
body:
I attended Stracathro Hospital for an umbilical hernia repair. The care I received was outstanding. From the moment I got there every member of staff involved in my care were amazing. They were friendly, informative & reassuring, I was made to feel at ease at all times. The hospital ward was immaculate and was a pleasant temperature, unlike some hospitals that are way too hot.  
I honestly couldn’t fault anything, but I would recommend a warm dressing gown as it could be cool for some people.

author: frel
title: A fabulous service
body:
The care at the Laser Clinic UHD is just exceptional.  
Every part of the process of attending this clinic is incredibly straightforward which is due to the obvious professionalism of the clinic team.  
Appointments are prompt and the staff are always well prepared for your arrival with notes ready etc.  
The treatment is clearly explained and the staff are friendly and chatty which distracts from the unavoidable discomfort of the procedure.  
This is a fabulous service and I can't imagine how it could be improved.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Happy69
title: All the staff were really lovely, caring and kind
body:
I went with chest pains and feeling very unwell, I was booked in and seen immediately, all the staff were really lovely, caring and kind, they put me at ease straight away!  
I was assessed, treated( ECG, blood tests & resistance exercises) and got results within a couple of hours, I felt really happy with the outcome and was able to go home with a weight lifted. Thank you so much Barnsley Hospital NHS ❤️

author: decemberhc37
title: Cervical smear test
body:
I booked my routine smear test. Reception team made it very easy and were really helpful, even when I had to change my appointment date at the last minute.  
Went for the smear, the nurse put me at ease, offered a chaperone, she was very gentle doing the smear, she communicated with me throughout, and there was no pain.  
Afterwards she checked with me that she had written my details down correctly and she gave very clear instructions regarding when to expect results and any further steps.  
Thank you very much.

author: Trostan
title: Dealing with the loss of my parents
body:
I lost my father several years ago which broke my heart, I've never been the same since. A couple of years later I lost my mother which broke my heart for the second time. I lived at home with them and had been their main carer which had been incredibly stressful and lonely and there was no light at the end of the tunnel, only death. As well as feeling isolated and depressed I became angry and felt abandoned by the rest of my family, I was left to carry the burden while their lives carried on as usual. My mother suffered from dementia and could be difficult.  
I was living in a bubble, I didn't go anywhere, I didn't socialise, I rarely saw friends, I felt drained all the time, I was mentally exhausted. I found it hard to concentrate, I would start things and never finish them, I became prone to angry outbursts where I would be consumed with rage, sometimes saying and doing things I would later regret. I would binge drink on Saturday nights, my one release as I saw it. My physical health suffered and I lost interest in hobbies I had been involved with most of my life, my life was in limbo. When my mother passed away I felt like a rudderless ship adrift in a storm tossed ocean. I felt lost and still exhausted.  
Two weeks later I received a request from social services saying they had overpaid my mother and wanted the money back. Their insensitivity took my breath away. I never replied. My mental health didn't improve, I continued to live like a hermit and I would drink to excess when alone late at night, always becoming emotional. In stressful situations I would in an instant become aggressive and ready to be violent. It was like I lost control and rage would take over.  
I knew I had a problem but I would never talk to family or friends about it so one day I phoned my health centre. I didn't even want to speak to my own doctor so I spoke to another one on the phone. A day later my doctor rang me and we talked. They offered medication but I don't take pills if at all possible so he said he would arrange someone to get in touch within the month. No one did.  
By this time I was on Universal Credit and had become friendly with my liaison. He offered to refer me to the Condition Management programme and a few weeks later I was contacted by one of their staff. We met once but most meetings were conducted via Zoom. A couple of times I felt it was a bit of a box-ticking exercise but I liked my contact and it was a great relief to be able to talk to someone about how I felt as I had never opened up to anyone before, and I felt like they really cared.  
I started to train again, as I have trained most of my life, and that helped me feel better and I started working on a book which had been postponed for a long time. Then one day I discovered Wim Hof, a remarkable man. I started doing his breathing and cold exposure techniques and felt so much better. He has developed his system over the years to improve all aspects of health but initially it was to help him cope with his own heartbreak when his wife committed suicide. I practiced his techniques for a couple of weeks and then signed up for a 10 week course to dive deeper into his methods and am thoroughly enjoying it.  
I feel better both physically and mentally, (I am calmer). I sleep well and I don't feel the cold as much anymore. Ultimately I would like to become an instructor of his method and help people who suffer from physical and mental issues, because, like Wim, I don't believe pills are the answer, they treat the symptoms but don't fix the problem.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Ak92
title: Community Midwife
body:
I first met midwife Emma when I was 37 weeks pregnant. I instantly clicked with her and trusted everything she said. The next time we met was in my home when she was doing postnatal checks on myself and my baby.  
She really made both myself & my partner feel relaxed & informed about all the questions we had for her in the difficult early days with a newborn.  
Emma returned several times as our baby had jaundice and we both felt the consistency of having the same person (which wasn't planned) helped us, especially someone with such compassion and professionalism about her job.  
Emma is obviously very passionate about her role as this reflects in her interaction with not only myself as a new mum but how she cared for our baby. She is a credit to your team and the NHS.

author: JLAV
title: Brilliant maternity services
body:
I recently attended the maternity assessment unit in Daisy Hill as I thought I was in labour. I was taken care of by midwife Phil. She was so good at her job and has excellent knowledge. She made me feels so much better and reassured. She was so approachable and friendly and she listened to my concerns. Couldn’t of asked for anyone better.  
Dhh maternity services provide such brilliant services.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very Caring
body: I was on both Ward 12 and the Ward 15. Staff were brilliant and very caring including catering staff. Medically I have to indicate that I was looked after and cared for very well and I am now delighted to be home.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Another Jenny
title: I was treated with dignity and kindness throughout
body: I went for a colonoscopy at Grantham feeling very scared and anxious. The nurse, Jenny, who I initially spoke to on the phone prior to procedure accompanied me through my colonoscopy and saw me through recovery afterwards. The care from herself, the other nurses, and the doctor was amazing. They went out of their way to make a difficult time much easier and I was treated with dignity and kindness throughout.

title: Absolutely disgusted
body: I had a telephone triage regarding my 6 months old baby, she was given an online prescription which was suppose to be fax to the chemist and sent out to me the same day It’s been 4 days I rang them surgery up twice, and was always advices to ring before 1 regarding the prescription. However, when I did ring before 1 Was always waiting in the queue for approximately 50 mins and had no one answer. It is the 4th day and I still have not received the prescription. I have rang the chemist up just in case however they have still not revived the prescription from the surgery. This is absolutely ridiculous. And my daughters health has worsen.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are excellent
body:
Accident and emergency was decent. I thought they were quite efficient at seeing people, it was just waiting on results like bloods. The level of care was good and I felt like I got the necessary care needed.  
The staff were very good I have to say, they are very busy and under pressure.  
Female Surgical has been good and I have no complaints about anything. The food is edible, but it is not the best. That is probably the worst thing about being here. The level of care is very good although the equipment they are using some of it looks quite worn and old.  
The staff are excellent, you can tell they are the reason a lot of people here are not getting depressed and sad that they are here for long periods of time. They have great attitudes toward their jobs.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wonderful surgical clinic
body: Having cararact surgery could have been quite daunting but due to the kindness and consideration by both the surgeon  and nursing staff for me this was an almost pleasant experience, with no pain or side effects. I would highly recommend this clinic.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff know what they are doing
body:
Accident and Emergency was okay, the waiting times are the problem.  
The staff are very nice and explained everything to me that I needed to know.  
Female Surgical is good, the environment is fine, and it is always clean. The level of care I am receiving is very good, the staff know what they are doing.  
The booking to visit people is a hassle, and so is the only two designated people as I have not seen some of my family in a while.  
The staff are very good at their jobs, they are a credit to the NHS. They are top class people who are the best.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I feel a part of my treatment.
body:
Accident and Emergency was not really the best, the time I had waiting on painkillers was too long. I think they had forgot about me which was fair as they were busy, but I did need to ask twice for them. That was my only problem.  
The staff were okay, they were all over the place since it was so busy.  
Female Surgical has been well organised and they all seem to work well as a team. The environment is clean and tidy, definitely no complaints about that.  
The staff are outstanding, you can tell they have experience and know what they are doing. They keep me informed on what is happening and my results, I feel a part of my treatment.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Caring GP
body:
I booked and appointment without any problem using the surgery website in the morning . I got a text message to say the GP would ring me up. The GP rang me up that same morning, the doctor dealt with several health issues over the phone and gave me a face to face appointment for that same morning. I got a text to tell me the time to be seen. The doctor was exceptional, during the consultation I was given another appointment for the following day for further investigation. I received the appointment time by text again not only once but twice the second as a reminder. I saw the paramedic the following day who was pleasant and caring. I was reassured and taken care by the team regarding all my health issues which have improved after the phone call and face to face visits and I feel better.

 Thank you to all the members of staff during these difficult times

title: Can’t recommend enough
body:
I recently joined this practice after being asked to find a new Gp due to a change of address
I joined this practice after reading some reviews and I have to say what an excellent choice I made 
Very accommodating professional team who have given me confidence that there are great practices out there
I can’t thank them enough 
I’ve been seen by a Dr and the consultation was thorough , I was referred very quickly for scans and physio within a week
Thankyou to you all at Hopwood Mc for the great service you are providing , you deserve the great reviews

author: pictorbg56
title: The team were friendly, helpful and very supportive
body:
I was having to approach Access to Work to gain support to sort out adjustments for working with a number of disabilities.  
They did an assessment but asked me to approach the Northern Health & Social Care Trust Condition Management Team to discuss coping with a number of disabilities.  
The Condition Management Team ran Zoom talks and meetings and provided information & advice on issues like pain management, back care and discussion on coping with stress.  
The team were friendly, helpful and very supportive. The talks were very helpful in finding ways for you to cope with disabilities.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Misinformation
body: I have an autism and adhd diagnosis and struggle with day to day life at times. I have been trying for 2 years to be seen by someone and they said they will refer me to someone who specialises in this...2 years later still nothing and no record of the 'referal' I needed an updated diagnosis letter for certain things and they put the wrong diagnosis with no information about the struggles I experience. Was told when I had a conversation with the surgery that I have these conditions and that I struggle with certain things the response was "many people do" still waiting to be seen

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: very good  practice
body: Dr Aggarwal has been a very helpful doctor, he goes the extra mile to resolve any health issues I may have. He has been my doctor for a number of years, he has been a professional, caring and friendly doctor. I would him recommend him to anyone who was looking for a good doctor.

title: Excellent service
body:
I need to take a moment to review the service recently received from Weeping Cross Surgery, I booked a telephone appointment which was very efficient & backed up by an in surgery visit within 24 hours! Excellent use of technology with text reminders, notes via the NHS app and subsequent email traffic all keeping me well informed, appears that this surgery certainly has embraced technology allowing it to also keep the human touch.
Thank You - very impressed

title: Awful Practice
body: Still waiting for them to issue me my repeat prescription despite requesting it 21 days ago. In that time I've often had to wait over a week just to get a reply from staff about what's going on with my medication. Being cut off from my medication has been disastrous for my health.

title: No booking
body: I booked an appointment on the 16th to be seen for physio! Got told to I would be seen on the 25th at 8:00 when I arrived there was no recall of my booking nothing had been logged at all, so I had completely wasted my time. The gentleman who I spoke to when I arrived expressed his apologies and said he couldn’t understand how this has happened.

title: Brilliant people
body:
Good morning, 
I came to ENT yesterday afternoon because I'd lost my hearing in my right ear since last September. 
I was seen by several people for various tests, and then my consultant diagnosed that I needed an ear grommet and inserted it immediately and...
I can hear 🎉 👂. 
I was in and out in an hour. 
Lovely, kind professional and compassionate people. 
I cried and laughed in equal measure. 
Just thank you. 
Katie.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: overworked staff
body: brought in by ambulance didnt seem busy 12pm cleaning staff and the tea lady made a lovely cup of tea seen by a nurse for an ecg and blood tests everywhere was clean felt looked after but got moved twice to a&e then minor injuries.felt sorry for a deaf lady and lady who was in a&e from 9.30 am to 2pm. never enjoy going to hospital too many doors and corridors glad to find my way out.always been helped with directions and pointed to the right room,its service is good

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good staff
body: After visiting the practice I found the reception staff were friendly and helpful,the doctors and practice nurses are always friendly and caring.

title: Really helpful team doing their best in tough…
body: Have always fund the team here to be super helpful and courteous at all times.   I have confidence when I call/ contact  them that they will do their best to help me and are very responsive using the online service also.

author: Peanut2022
title: You were incredibly fast acting, thoughtful and kind
body:
We, as a new family of four, want to express our huge amount of gratitude and appreciation for the staff members we encountered during our short time in triage and Labour Ward.  
In particular Chelsea in triage who made my husband and I feel extremely at ease. She was genuinely caring, attentive, helpful and just exactly what we needed.  
Also to Leah in Labour Ward who, after a quick introduction, helped deliver our beautiful daughter. You were incredibly fast acting, thoughtful and kind. You are both huge assets to your teams.  
We can’t thank everyone enough!

author: pegasuspb74
title: Thank you
body: I would like to thank Alison for all her help with getting me mobile again. I broke my leg (femur bone), and with her help, with exercise and physio, I am getting better with my walking. Thanks again, Alison.

title: Great service
body: From the reception staff to the nurses this was a great service. Everyone was kind, courteous and I had my problem seen to in the most professional manner - hope i won’t be back - but if i do need advice, I’d be happy to return here

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great support
body: Always found the staff well mannered and the doctors very helpful with good people skills since moving here around 5 years ago. The nurse I saw today was so nice and such a lovely disposition about her. Bloods taken and hardly felt a thing-well done all!

title: Good service
body:
I called first thing today and to my suprize was offered a f2f appt this morning.

The medical practitioner who cared for me was kind, listened to me and gave me good advice and treatment.

My last 2 interaction with this practice have both been really positive, 
as a medical practitioner myself I understand how hard working in this profession can be at times, but you are All doing an amazing job, so please keep up the good work.

Thank you

author: soilyx43
title: Prescription delays
body:
The chemist requested my husband's medication 10 days before it ran out. After 2 weeks of no response from the surgery, we called and, with no apology, were told the prescription would be issued that day. My husband had been without his meds for a whole week already.  
We had to go away. On our return, still no medication. We called our local chemist and were told no script had been issued for him. We tried again today and were told the script was on the pharmacist's system but had not been sent to the pharmacy!  
We have the pills now but, the GP wants a BP reading. He hasn't had any BP meds for 2 weeks. His BP will be well high!

readBy.name: Steve Baker's Office, MP for Wycombe

title: Terrible service for disabled needing repeat…
body:
Supposed to give 7 days notice for repeat prescriptions, (delivery) but after 18 days still not arrived.
Phoned surgery and told to send a taxi to collect them.
Prescription always put at least 10 days before needed but rarely delivered without having to phone surgery to ask where it is. Last month luckily had daughter down so she collected after almost 2 weeks after repeat prescription put in.
